messageBody:

This is most of the way to what I was looking for. Can you take one more

Three Rivers Institute

tuomaskarkkainenri
Sent: Tuesday, January 06, 2009 2:52 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Re: Runner for non static inner class in JUnit 4.x



Kent,

essentially:

@Test
public void findsRunnerFromDeclaringClass() {
final Request request= Request.method(NonStaticInnerClass.class,
"methodName");
Assert.assertThat(request.getRunner(), Is.is(FakeRunner.class));
}

@RunWith(FakeRunner.class)
public static class DeclaringClass {

public class NonStaticInnerClass {
}
}

public static class FakeRunner extends Runner {
public FakeRunner(final Class<?> testClass) {
}

@Override
public Description getDescription() {
return Description.EMPTY;
}

@Override
public void run(final RunNotifier notifier) {
}
}

as Eclipse enters JUnit4 from:
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit4.runner.JUnit4TestMethodReference
constructor with a call to: Request.method(clazz, methodName)

best regards,
tuomas

> > > >
> > > > in JUnit4 speak:
> > > >
> > > > public class RegularJunit4 {
> > > > public class NonStaticInnerClass {
> > > > @Test
> > > > public void testMethod() {
> > > > }
> > > > }
> > > > }
> > > >
> > > > running testMethod() is not possible since NonStaticInnerClass
cannot
> > > > be instantiated from the outside.
> > > >
> > > > in JDave:
> > > >
> > > > @RunWith(JDaveRunner.class)
> > > > public static class ASpec extends Specification<Void> {
> > > > public class AContext {
> > > > public void aBehavior() {}
> > > > }
> > > > }
> > > >
> > > > AContext is instantiated by SpecRunner which JDaveRunner
delegates to.
> > > >
> > > > When I run this with current JUnit,
> > > > AllDefaultPossibilitiesBuilder#runnerForClass(final Class<?>
> > > > testClass) picks out the @RunWith annotation and uses that to
run my
> > > > spec(test class).
> > > >
> > > > However if I want to run just a single behavior (test method)
from
> > > > this spec for example from Eclipse. Eclipse tells JUnit to run
class
> > > > ASpec.AContext and method aBehavior JUnit then sees what builder
it
> > > > should use for AContext, and doesn't find the annotation there
and
> > > > tries to use the regular JUnit4 builder and since it's a JDave
spec it
> > > > fails to run.
> > > >
> > > > What I want to do is: in case AllDefaultPossibilitiesBuilder
notices
> > > > that the TestClass is a non-static member class, which it has no
> > > > chance of being able run anyway, it checks whether the declaring
class
> > > > of the testclass would be able to run it instead.
> > > >
> > > > In the case of JDave, the declaring class would have the
@RunWith
> > > > annotation, and with the Filter created by FilterRequest, JDave
can
> > > > then choose which Context and Spec it should actually allow to
run.
> > > >

> > > > Tuomas
